title: Typography
summary: Our typography guidelines outline how to use font styles, sizes,  and weights effectively across different elements, from headings  and body text to small UI details.

columns.text: Typography plays a crucial role in shaping the look and feel of our design. It not only impacts readability but also helps establish a consistent visual identity, guiding users through content with clarity  and hierarchy.
By maintaining consistency in typography, we create a cohesive user experience that enhances communication, reinforces brand identity, and improves overall design aesthetics.
Our typography guidelines outline how to use font styles, sizes,  and weights effectively across different elements, from headings  and body text to small UI details.
Font weight is an important tool in design that helps establish hierarchy, create emphasis, and improve readability of your design.
GDS – SEB SanSerif offers the weights bold, medium, the new weight book, regular and light. Our styles are using the middle spectra. Bold and light can be used in special cases.

Typography sizes help establish a clear visual hierarchy, guiding users through content effortlessly. Our type scale ranges from 82px down to 12px, with each size serving a specific role in structuring information effectively:
Hierarchy is shown through changes in font weight, size and colors. The updated type scale categorizes styles into roles.
Green type styles are defined by five roles – display, headline, preamble, body and detail.
These roles are more descriptive, allowing for simpler application across a broader range of use cases, from large to small screens.
Display text is meant to make a strong visual impact. Display fonts are typically used sparingly, as they are designed for aesthetics rather than long-form readability.
In terms of size, display text is significantly larger than regular headings, often used for hero sections
Headings help structure content and establish a clear hierarchy in your design. Heading levels range from H1 (largest) to H6 (smallest), each serving a different purpose.
Consistent use of heading sizes helps guide users through the content, improving readability. Keep the size differences noticeable but balanced for a clean and cohesive design.
A preamble appears below a heading and serves as a brief overview or summary that provides context or sets the tone for the content that follows.
Effective use of preambles enhances user engagement and helps clarify the purpose of the section or page.
In terms of size, the preamble is generally larger than body text but smaller than headings.
Body text is the main content of your design, used for paragraphs, articles and detailed information. Its primary function is readability, therefor it should be simple, clear, and consistent.
Proper line spacing and contrast also enhance clarity and user comfort when reading. Maintaining consistency in body text ensures a cohesive, user-friendly design.
Detail style is used for ui elements like buttons, form inputs and tooltips. It provides essential, concise information.
For size, detail text is set between 12px and 16px, depending on the component and context. It should be paired with adequate spacing and contrast to ensure readability.
Consistent use of detail text in UI components helps improve clarity and user experience while maintaining a clean, minimal design.
